subject: Re: [junit] failSame,. etc. will be public?
msgSnippet: #: by Kent Beck s words the mind was *winged* :# ... Hi! As I already said in a previous mail, I can see some usage of failX() methods (considering they are
messageBody:
#: by Kent Beck's words the mind was *winged* :#
> Elliotte,
>
> Thank you for pointing this out. The change was not intentional. I am interested in arguments for making them public, though.
>
> Sincerely yours,
>
> Kent Beck
> Three Rivers Institute
>

Hi!

As I already said in a previous mail, I can see some usage of failX() methods (considering they are
negation of assertX methods). The one I have no idea about is format().

:alex |.::the_mindstorm::.|

>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
>> Behalf Of Elliotte Harold
>> Sent: Thursday, July 28, 2005 1:02 PM
>> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>> Subject: [junit] failSame,. etc. will be public?
>>
>> I noticed the JUnit 4 Assert class has a few public methods
>> JUnit 3 made
>> private. Specifically
>>
>> failSame()
>> failNotSame()
>> failNotEquals()
>> format()
>>
>> Is it the intention to make these public in JUnit 4, or are they just
>> that way now for testing or some such and will eventually be made
>> private again?
>>
